SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.naef.jnlua
Class LuaState

java.lang.Object
  com.naef.jnlua.LuaState

public class LuaState
extends java.lang.Object

JNLua core class representing a Lua instance.

The class performs extensive checking on all arguments and its state. Specifically, the following exceptions are thrown under the indicated conditions:

Exception When
NullPointerException if an argument is null and the API does not explicitly specify that the argument may be null
IllegalStateException if the Lua state is closed and the API does not explicitly specify that the method may be invoked on a closed Lua state
IllegalArgumentException if a stack index refers to a non-valid stack location and the API does not explicitly specify that the stack index may be non-valid
IllegalArgumentException if a stack index refers to an stack location with value type that is different from the value type explicitly specified in the API
IllegalArgumentException if a count is negative or out of range and the API does not explicitly specify that the count may be negative or out of range
LuaRuntimeException if a Lua runtime error occurs
LuaSyntaxException if the syntax of a Lua chunk is incorrect
LuaMemoryAllocationException if the Lua memory allocator runs out of memory or if a JNI allocation fails
LuaGcMetamethodException if an error occurs running a __gc metamethod during garbage collection
LuaMessageHandlerException if an error occurs running the message handler of a protected call

Constructor Detail

LuaState

public LuaState()
Creates a new instance. The class loader of this Lua state is set to the context class loader of the calling thread. The Java reflector and the converter are initialized with the default implementations.

See Also:
getClassLoader(), setClassLoader(ClassLoader), getJavaReflector(), setJavaReflector(JavaReflector), getConverter(), setConverter(Converter)
Method Detail

getClassLoader

public java.lang.ClassLoader getClassLoader()
Returns the class loader of this Lua state. The class loader is used for dynamically loading classes.

The method may be invoked on a closed Lua state.

Returns:
the class loader

setClassLoader

public void setClassLoader(java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader)
Sets the class loader of this Lua state. The class loader is used for dynamically loading classes.

The method may be invoked on a closed Lua state.

Parameters:
classLoader - the class loader to set

getJavaReflector

public JavaReflector getJavaReflector()
Returns the Java reflector of this Lua state.

The method may be invoked on a closed Lua state.

Returns:
the Java reflector converter

setJavaReflector

public void setJavaReflector(JavaReflector javaReflector)
Sets the Java reflector of this Lua state.

The method may be invoked on a closed Lua state.

Parameters:
javaReflector - the Java reflector

getMetamethod

public JavaFunction getMetamethod(java.lang.Object obj,
                                  JavaReflector.Metamethod metamethod)
Returns a metamethod for a specified object. If the object implements the JavaReflector interface, the metamethod is first queried from the object. If the object provides the requested metamethod, that metamethod is returned. Otherwise, the method returns the metamethod provided by the Java reflector configured in this Lua state.

Clients requiring access to metamethods should go by this method to ensure consistent class-by-class overriding of the Java reflector.

Parameters:
obj - the object, or null
Returns:
the Java reflector

getConverter

public Converter getConverter()
Returns the converter of this Lua state.

The method may be invoked on a closed Lua state.

Returns:
the converter

setConverter

public void setConverter(Converter converter)
Sets the converter of this Lua state.

The method may be invoked on a closed Lua state.

Parameters:
converter - the converter

isOpen

public final boolean isOpen()
Returns whether this Lua state is open.

The method may be invoked on a closed Lua state.

Returns:
whether this Lua state is open

close

public void close()
Closes this Lua state and releases all resources.

The method may be invoked on a closed Lua state and has no effect in that case.

gc

public int gc(LuaState.GcAction what,
              int data)
Performs a garbage collection operation. Please see the Lua Reference Manual for an explanation of the actions, arguments and return values.

Parameters:
what - the operation to perform
data - the argument required by some operations
Returns:
a return value depending on the GC operation performed

openLib

public void openLib(LuaState.Library library)
Opens the specified library in this Lua state. The library is pushed onto the stack.

Parameters:
library - the library

openLibs

public void openLibs()
Opens the Lua standard libraries and the JNLua Java module in this Lua state.

The method opens all libraries defined by the LuaState.Library enumeration.

register

public void register(NamedJavaFunction namedJavaFunction)
Registers a named Java function as a global variable.

Parameters:
namedJavaFunction - the Java function to register

register

public void register(java.lang.String moduleName,
                     NamedJavaFunction[] namedJavaFunctions,
                     boolean global)
Registers a module and pushes the module on the stack. Optionally, a module can be registered globally. As of Lua 5.2, modules are not expected to set global variables anymore.

Parameters:
moduleName - the module name
namedJavaFunctions - the Java functions of the module
global - whether to register the module globally

load

public void load(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                 java.lang.String chunkName,
                 java.lang.String mode)
          throws java.io.IOException
Loads a Lua chunk from an input stream and pushes it on the stack as a function. Depending on the value of mode, the the Lua chunk can either be a pre-compiled binary chunk or a UTF-8 encoded text chunk.

Parameters:
inputStream - the input stream
chunkName - the name of the chunk for use in error messages
mode - "b" to accept binary, "t" to accept text, or "bt" to accept both
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

load

public void load(java.lang.String chunk,
                 java.lang.String chunkName)
Loads a Lua chunk from a string and pushes it on the stack as a function. The string must contain a source chunk.

Parameters:
chunk - the Lua source chunk
chunkName - the name of the chunk for use in error messages

dump

public void dump(java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
          throws java.io.IOException
Dumps the function on top of the stack as a pre-compiled binary chunk into an output stream.

Parameters:
outputStream - the output stream
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

call

public void call(int argCount,
                 int returnCount)
Calls a Lua function. The function to call and the specified number of arguments are on the stack. After the call, the specified number of returns values are on stack. If the number of return values has been specified as MULTRET, the number of values on the stack corresponds the to number of values actually returned by the called function.

Parameters:
argCount - the number of arguments
returnCount - the number of return values, or MULTRET to accept all values returned by the function

getGlobal

public void getGlobal(java.lang.String name)
Pushes the value of a global variable on the stack.

Parameters:
name - the global variable name

               throws LuaMemoryAllocationException,
                      LuaRuntimeException
Sets the value on top of the stack as a global variable and pops the value from the stack.

Parameters:
name - the global variable name
Throws:

pushJavaObject

public void pushJavaObject(java.lang.Object object)
Pushes a Java object on the stack with conversion. The object is processed the by the configured converter.

Parameters:
object - the Java object
See Also:
getConverter(), setConverter(Converter)

pushJavaObjectRaw

public void pushJavaObjectRaw(java.lang.Object object)
Pushes a Java object on the stack. The object is pushed "as is", i.e. without conversion.

If you require to push a Lua value that represents the Java object, then invoke pushJavaObject(object).

You cannot push null without conversion since null is not a Java object. The converter converts null to nil.

Parameters:
object - the Java object
See Also:
pushJavaObject(Object)

pushNil

public void pushNil()
Pushes a nil value on the stack.

public void pushNumber(double n)
Pushes a number value on the stack.

Parameters:
n - the number to push

pushString

public void pushString(java.lang.String s)
Pushes a string value on the stack.

Parameters:
s - the string value to push

isJavaObject

public boolean isJavaObject(int index,
                            java.lang.Class<?> type)
Returns whether the value at the specified stack index is convertible to a Java object of the specified type. The conversion is checked by the configured converter.

The stack index may be non-valid.

Parameters:
index - the stack index
Returns:
whether the value is convertible to a Java object of the specified type
See Also:
setConverter(Converter), getConverter()

isJavaObjectRaw

public boolean isJavaObjectRaw(int index)
Returns whether the value at the specified stack index is a Java object.

Note that the method does not perform conversion. If you want to check if a value is convertible to a Java object, then invoke isJavaObject(index, Object.class).

The stack index may be non-valid.

Parameters:
index - the stack index
Returns:
whether the value is a Java object
See Also:
isJavaObject(int, Class)

compare

public boolean compare(int index1,
                       int index2,
                       LuaState.RelOperator operator)
Compares the values at two specified stack indexes for the specified operator according to Lua semantics.

The stack index may be non-valid in case the EQ operator is specified.

Parameters:
index1 - the first stack index
index2 - the second stack index
operator - the operator
Returns:
the result of the comparison
Since:
JNLua 1.0.0

equal

public boolean equal(int index1,
                     int index2)
Deprecated. instead use compare(int, int, RelOperator)

Returns whether the values at two specified stack indexes are equal according to Lua semantics.

Parameters:
index1 - the first stack index
index2 - the second stack index
Returns:
whether the values are equal

length

public int length(int index)
Deprecated. instead use rawLen(int)

Returns the length of the value at the specified stack index. Please see the Lua Reference Manual for the definition of the raw length of a value.

Parameters:
index - the stack index
Returns:
the length

lessThan

public boolean lessThan(int index1,
                        int index2)
                 throws LuaMemoryAllocationException,
                        LuaRuntimeException
Deprecated. instead use compare(int, int, RelOperator)

Returns whether a value at a first stack index is less than the value at a second stack index according to Lua semantics.

Parameters:
index1 - the first stack index
index2 - the second stack index
Returns:
whether the value at the first index is less than the value at the second index
Throws:
LuaMemoryAllocationException
LuaRuntimeException

rawEqual

public boolean rawEqual(int index1,
                        int index2)
Bypassing metatable logic, returns whether the values at two specified stack indexes are equal according to Lua semantics.

Parameters:
index1 - the first stack index
index2 - the second stack index
Returns:
whether the values are equal

rawLen

public int rawLen(int index)
Bypassing metatable logic, returns the length of the value at the specified stack index. Please see the Lua Reference Manual for the definition of the raw length of a value.

Parameters:
index - the stack index
Returns:
the length
Since:
JNLua 1.0.0

toBoolean

public boolean toBoolean(int index)
Returns the boolean representation of the value at the specified stack index. The boolean representation is true for all values except false and nil. The method also returns false if the index is non-valid.

Parameters:
index - the stack index
Returns:
the boolean representation of the value

toInteger

public int toInteger(int index)
Returns the integer representation of the value at the specified stack index. The value must be a number or a string convertible to a number. Otherwise, the method returns 0.

Parameters:
index - the stack index
Returns:
the integer representation, or 0

toJavaFunction

public JavaFunction toJavaFunction(int index)
Returns the Java function of the value at the specified stack index. If the value is not a Java function, the method returns null.

Parameters:
index - the stack index
Returns:
the Java function, or null

toJavaObject

public <T> T toJavaObject(int index,
                          java.lang.Class<T> type)
Returns a Java object of the specified type representing the value at the specified stack index. The value must be convertible to a Java object of the specified type. The conversion is executed by the configured converter.

Parameters:
index - the stack index
type - the Java type to convert to
Returns:
the object
Throws:
java.lang.ClassCastException - if the conversion is not supported by the converter
See Also:
getConverter(), setConverter(Converter)

toJavaObjectRaw

public java.lang.Object toJavaObjectRaw(int index)
Returns the Java object of the value at the specified stack index. If the value is not a Java object, the method returns null.

Note that the method does not convert values to Java objects. If you require any Java object that represents the value at the specified index, then invoke toJavaObject(index, Object.class).

Parameters:
index - the stack index
Returns:
the Java object, or null
See Also:
toJavaObject(int, Class)

toNumber

public double toNumber(int index)
Returns the number representation of the value at the specified stack index. The value must be a number or a string convertible to a number. Otherwise, the method returns 0.0.

Parameters:
index - the stack index
Returns:
the number representation, or 0.0

toPointer

public long toPointer(int index)
Returns the pointer representation of the value at the specified stack index. The value must be a table, thread, function or userdata (such as a Java object.) Otherwise, the method returns 0L. Different values return different pointers. Other than that, the returned value has no portable significance.

Parameters:
index - the stack index
Returns:
the pointer representation, or 0L if none

toString

public java.lang.String toString(int index)
Returns the string representation of the value at the specified stack index. The value must be a string or a number. If the value is a number, it is in place converted to a string. Otherwise, the method returns null.

Parameters:
index - the stack index
Returns:
the string representation, or null

type

public LuaType type(int index)
Returns the type of the value at the specified stack index.

The stack index may be non-valid.

Parameters:
index - the stack index
Returns:
the type, or null if the stack index is non-valid

typeName

public java.lang.String typeName(int index)
Returns the name of the type at the specified stack index. The type name is the display text for the Lua type except for Java objects where the type name is the canonical class name.

The stack index may be non-valid in which case the method returns the string "none".

Parameters:
index - the index
Returns:
the type name
See Also:
LuaType.displayText(), Class.getCanonicalName()

absIndex

public int absIndex(int index)
Returns the absolute stack index of the specified index.

Parameters:
index - the stack index
Returns:
the absolute stack index
Since:
JNLua 1.0.0

arith

public void arith(LuaState.ArithOperator operator)
Performs an arithmetic operation with values on top of the stack using Lua semantics.

Parameters:
operator - the operator to apply
Since:
JNLua 1.0.0

concat

public void concat(int n)
Concatenates the specified number values on top of the stack and replaces them with the concatenated value.

Parameters:
n - the number of values to concatenate

copy

public void copy(int fromIndex,
                 int toIndex)
Copies a value at a specified index to another index, replacing the value at that index.

Parameters:
fromIndex - the index to copy from
toIndex - the index to copy to
Since:
JNLua 1.0.0

getTop

public int getTop()
Returns the number of values on the stack.

Returns:
the number of values on the tack

len

public void len(int index)
Pushes the length of the value at the specified stack index on the stack. The value pushed by the method corresponds to the Lua # operator.

Parameters:
index - the index for which to push the length
Since:
JNLua 1.0.0

insert

public void insert(int index)
Pops the value on top of the stack inserting it at the specified index and moving up elements above that index.

Parameters:
index - the stack index

pop

public void pop(int count)
Pops values from the stack.

Parameters:
count - the number of values to pop

pushValue

public void pushValue(int index)
Pushes the value at the specified index on top of the stack.

Parameters:
index - the stack index

remove

public void remove(int index)
Removes the value at the specified stack index moving down elements above that index.

Parameters:
index - the stack index

replace

public void replace(int index)
Replaces the value at the specified index with the value popped from the top of the stack.

Parameters:
index - the stack index

setTop

public void setTop(int index)
Sets the specified index as the new top of the stack.

The new top of the stack may be above the current top of the stack. In this case, new values are set to nil.

Parameters:
index - the index of the new top of the stack

getTable

public void getTable(int index)
Pushes on the stack the value indexed by the key on top of the stack in the table at the specified index. The key is replaced by the value from the table.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the table

getField

public void getField(int index,
                     java.lang.String key)
Pushes on the stack the value indexed by the specified string key in the table at the specified index.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the table
key - the string key

newTable

public void newTable()
Creates a new table and pushes it on the stack.

newTable

public void newTable(int arrayCount,
                     int recordCount)
Creates a new table with pre-allocated space for a number of array elements and record elements and pushes it on the stack.

Parameters:
arrayCount - the number of array elements
recordCount - the number of record elements

next

public boolean next(int index)
Pops a key from the stack and pushes on the stack the next key and its value in the table at the specified index. If there is no next key, the key is popped but nothing is pushed. The method returns whether there is a next key.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the table
Returns:
whether there is a next key

rawGet

public void rawGet(int index)
Bypassing metatable logic, pushes on the stack the value indexed by the key on top of the stack in the table at the specified index. The key is replaced by the value from the table.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the table

rawGet

public void rawGet(int index,
                   int key)
Bypassing metatable logic, pushes on the stack the value indexed by the specified integer key in the table at the specified index.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the table
key - the integer key

rawSet

public void rawSet(int index)
Bypassing metatable logic, sets the value on top of the stack in the table at the specified index using the value on the second highest stack position as the key. Both the value and the key are popped from the stack.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the table

rawSet

public void rawSet(int index,
                   int key)
Bypassing metatable logic, sets the value on top of the stack in the table at the specified index using the specified integer key. The value is popped from the stack.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the table
key - the integer key

setTable

public void setTable(int index)
Sets the value on top of the stack in the table at the specified index using the value on the second highest stack position as the key. Both the value and the key are popped from the stack.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the table

setField

public void setField(int index,
                     java.lang.String key)
Sets the value on top of the stack in the table at the specified index using the specified string key. The value is popped from the stack.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the table
key - the string key

getMetafield

public boolean getMetafield(int index,
                            java.lang.String key)
Pushes on the stack the value of the named field in the metatable of the value at the specified index and returns true. If the value does not have a metatable or if the metatable does not contain the named field, nothing is pushed and the method returns false.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the value to get the metafield from
key - the string key
Returns:
whether the metafield was pushed on the stack

getMetatable

public boolean getMetatable(int index)
Pushes on the stack the metatable of the value at the specified index. If the value does not have a metatable, the method returns false and nothing is pushed.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the value to get the metatable from
Returns:
whether the metatable was pushed on the stack

setMetatable

public boolean setMetatable(int index)
Sets the value on top of the stack as the metatable of the value at the specified index. The metatable to be set is popped from the stack regardless whether it can be set or not.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the value to set the metatable for
Returns:
whether the metatable was set

newThread

public void newThread()
Pops the start function of a new Lua thread from the stack and creates the new thread with that start function. The new thread is pushed on the stack.

resume

public int resume(int index,
                  int argCount)
Resumes the thread at the specified stack index, popping the specified number of arguments from the top of the stack and passing them to the resumed thread. The method returns the number of values pushed on the stack as the return values of the resumed thread.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the thread
argCount - the number of arguments to pass
Returns:
the number of values returned by the thread

status

public int status(int index)
Returns the status of the thread at the specified stack index. If the thread is in initial state of has finished its execution, the method returns 0. If the thread has yielded, the method returns YIELD. Other return values indicate errors for which an exception has been thrown.

Parameters:
index - the index
Returns:
the status

yield

public int yield(int returnCount)
Yields the running thread, popping the specified number of values from the top of the stack and passing them as return values to the thread which has resumed the running thread. The method must be used exclusively at the exit point of Java functions, i.e. return luaState.yield(n).

Parameters:
returnCount - the number of results to pass
Returns:
the return value of the Java function

ref

public int ref(int index)
Stores the value on top of the stack in the table at the specified index and returns the integer key of the value in that table as a reference. The value is popped from the stack.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the table where to store the value
Returns:
the reference integer key
See Also:
unref(int, int)

unref

public void unref(int index,
                  int reference)
Removes a previously created reference from the table at the specified index. The value is removed from the table and its integer key of the reference is freed for reuse.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the table where the value was stored
reference - the reference integer key
See Also:
ref(int)

tableSize

public int tableSize(int index)
Counts the number of entries in a table.

The method provides optimized performance over a Java implementation of the same functionality due to the reduced number of JNI transitions.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the table
Returns:
the number of entries in the table

tableMove

public void tableMove(int index,
                      int from,
                      int to,
                      int count)
Moves the specified number of sequential elements in a table used as an array from one index to another.

The method provides optimized performance over a Java implementation of the same functionality due to the reduced number of JNI transitions.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the table
from - the index to move from
to - the index to move to
count - the number of elements to move

checkArg

public void checkArg(int index,
                     boolean condition,
                     java.lang.String msg)
Checks if a condition is true for the specified function argument. If not, the method throws a Lua runtime exception with the specified error message.

Parameters:
index - the argument index
condition - the condition
msg - the error message

checkEnum

public <T extends java.lang.Enum<T>> T checkEnum(int index,
                                                 T[] values)
Checks if the value of the specified function argument is a string or a number matching the name of one of the specified enum values. If so, the argument value is returned as an enum value. Otherwise, the method throws a Lua runtime exception with a descriptive error message.

Parameters:
index - the argument index
values - the enum values
Returns:
the string value
Since:
JNLua 1.0.0

checkEnum

public <T extends java.lang.Enum<T>> T checkEnum(int index,
                                                 T[] values,
                                                 T d)
Checks if the value of the specified function argument is a string or a number matching one of the specified enum values. If so, the argument value is returned as an enum value. If the specified stack index is non-valid or if its value is nil, the method returns the specified default value. Otherwise, the method throws a Lua runtime exception with a descriptive error message.

Parameters:
index - the argument index
values - the enum values
d - the default value
Returns:
the string value, or the default value
Since:
JNLua 1.0.0

checkInteger

public int checkInteger(int index)
Checks if the value of the specified function argument is a number or a string convertible to a number. If so, the argument value is returned as an integer. Otherwise, the method throws a Lua runtime exception with a descriptive error message.

Parameters:
index - the argument index
Returns:
the integer value

checkInteger

public int checkInteger(int index,
                        int d)
Checks if the value of the specified function argument is a number or a string convertible to a number. If so, the argument value is returned as an integer. If the specified stack index is non-valid or if its value is nil, the method returns the specified default value. Otherwise, the method throws a Lua runtime exception with a descriptive error message.

Parameters:
index - the argument index
d - the default value
Returns:
the integer value, or the default value

checkJavaObject

public <T> T checkJavaObject(int index,
                             java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
Checks if the value of the specified function argument is convertible to a Java object of the specified type. If so, the argument value is returned as a Java object of the specified type. Otherwise, the method throws a Lua runtime exception with a descriptive error message.

Note that the converter converts nil to null. Therefore, the method may return null if the value is nil.

Parameters:
index - the argument index
clazz - the expected type
Returns:
the Java object, or null

checkJavaObject

public <T> T checkJavaObject(int index,
                             java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                             T d)
Checks if the value of the specified function argument is convertible to a Java object of the specified type. If so, the argument value is returned as a Java object of the specified type. If the specified stack index is non-valid or if its value is nil, the method returns the specified default value. Otherwise, the method throws a Lua runtime exception with a descriptive error message.

Parameters:
index - the argument index
clazz - the expected class
d - the default value
Returns:
the Java object, or the default value

Parameters:
index - the argument index
Returns:
the number value

                          double d)

Parameters:
index - the argument index
options - the options
Returns:
the string value

                       java.lang.String[] options,

                      LuaType type)

getProxy

public LuaValueProxy getProxy(int index)
Returns a proxy object for the Lua value at the specified index.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the Lua value
Returns:
the Lua value proxy

getProxy

public <T> T getProxy(int index,
                      java.lang.Class<T> interfaze)
Returns a proxy object implementing the specified interface in Lua. The table at the specified stack index contains the method names from the interface as keys and the Lua functions implementing the interface methods as values. The returned object always implements the LuaValueProxy interface in addition to the specified interface.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the table
interfaze - the interface
Returns:
the proxy object

getProxy

public LuaValueProxy getProxy(int index,
                              java.lang.Class<?>[] interfaces)
Returns a proxy object implementing the specified list of interfaces in Lua. The table at the specified stack index contains the method names from the interfaces as keys and the Lua functions implementing the interface methods as values. The returned object always implements the LuaValueProxy interface in addition to the specified interfaces.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the table
interfaces - the interfaces
Returns:
the proxy object
